group_1.textRight: Could you be...the Guardian Spirits of Christmas...?

group_1.textLeft: Thaat's riight!

group_1.textCenter: You just said it outright...well, there's no@choice now, is there?
If you don't mind, could you help us?

group_1.textRight: Yeah...S-sure can! ...What do I need to do?

group_1.textCenter: I would like you to pick this sketchbook up and@return it to its owner.

group_1.textRight: Got it, Guardian Spirit! But, who is that?

group_1.textLeft: A girl named Karin Misono from Sakae@Comprehensive School!
Mii, what's wrong?

group_1.textRight: Ah...Mama.
I want to return this sketchbook to its owner.
The Guardian Spiritsâ€•

group_1.textLeft: Guardian Spirits...?
Sure it's a sketchbook that someone dropped,@although...
There's a name written on it... looks like a child@from Sakae Comprehensive School.
Sure thing, shall we go deliver it?

group_1.textRight: Yeah!

group_1.textCenter: I dropped my precious sketchbook somewhere...
When I left the house I know I had it...

group_1.textLeft: Um...could that sketchbook be...?

group_1.textRight: Ah...is this yours?
This boy here picked it up on the road back there.
We were about to go to the school to drop it off.

group_1.textLeft: Ah...thank you yeah.
I thought I was going to lose all of my new work@I just drew!
*Sigh*...

group_1.textRight: Looks like we've managed to avoid disappearing@again.
Was that good, Guardian Spirit?

group_1.textLeft: Yeah, perfect!
...Do you know about the Christmas Guardian@Spirits?

group_1.textRight: The Guardian Spirits that appear in "Christmas@Bonds," right?
It's my friend's favorite book.
Though she talks about it a lot...

group_1.textLeft: ...Did something happen?

group_1.textRight: ...We got in a fight recently.

group_1.textLeft: Would you like to make up?

group_1.textRight: ...Yes.
I want to apologize, but I have a hard time@saying it.

group_1.textLeft: This time...
You should go deliver a Christmas present.
What do you think of that opportunity?

group_1.textRight: Ah...that sounds nice!
I never thought such good advice would come@out of your mouth, Touka.

group_1.textLeft: There's no deep meaning behind it.
Since we're talking about presents I just thought@of that is all!

group_1.textRight: So that's it.
Aside from that...
This "Christmas Bonds" is a book that people@rarely know about...
But he also knew of it...?

group_1.textLeft: ...Did he hear about it from the girl we met@earlier?

group_1.textRight: Maybe that's the case?
I wonder...what kind of Christmas present@I should get...?

group_1.textLeft: What about that book we appeared in?
Since that book is incredibly rare...
Doesn't that girl borrow it from the library often@just to read it?

group_1.textRight: Woah! How'd you know that?!

group_1.textLeft: ...I just heard about it.
You would have to be patient to find it at a@secondhand bookstore, but...
I'm sure it would make her happy.

group_1.textRight: Got it, I'll try my best!

group_1.textLeft: ...Are you done now, Mii?

group_1.textRight: Ah, Mama?

group_1.textLeft: ...Were you talking to the Guardian Spirits again?

group_1.textRight: Y-yeah...Mama may not be able to see them,@though...

group_1.textLeft: ...If Mii says so, I'll believe it.

group_1.textRight: Thanks!
Um... I need to go soon.

group_1.textCenter: Sure, good luck on your book hunt.

group_1.textRight: Mii, hmm...there's really no mistaking it.
That child is friends with the girl we met at@Mizutoku Market Street.

group_1.textLeft: Tomorrow would you like to go visit Mii's house?

group_1.textRight: ...No, I want to go to the library.

group_1.textLeft: She said Mii, too.

group_1.textRight: It's nice that the two mothers are so kind.
She even waited for him to finish telling his story.

group_1.textLeft: Those two were the only ones who could@perceive us...

group_1.textRight: Like that girl from earlier...
Can only children who believe in good Guardian@Spirits see us...?

group_1.textLeft: We can't confirm or deny anything with just@two samples.

group_1.textRight: ...Well, that's true.
...Although, our actions just now were a little@careless.
Time paradoxes are a problem for us...
Yet we can interfere with the past.

group_1.textLeft: I am also bothered by it.

group_1.textRight: I thought Touka would have stopped me midway.

group_1.textLeft: Well, there is the fact that we were saved@thanks to that child.
I wonder if we should keep quiet until there's a@definitive phenomenon again.

group_1.textRight: ...Hmm, so even Touka is capable of feeling@gratitude.

group_1.textLeft: Geniuses have feelings too you knooow!

group_1.textRight: Ah...
Again, the book is...!

group_1.textLeft: I want to go home already.
